name: Marriott Marina del Rey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in a good location. In moderate traffic, it's only 20 minutes to Santa Monica, 30 minutes to Beverly Hills, and 30 minutes to Brentwood. My girlfriend and I got upgraded to a concierge level room due to my Marriott Platinum status. The room was comfortable though the bathroom was a bit older and had one decorative tile missing on the floor. Though it wasn't an issue for us, it could be for some other guests. Views of the Marina were adequate; I would recommend getting a view of Santa Monica instead on the opposite end of the hotel. Concierge breakfast service was superb. All in all, it is a good hotel at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Good service and Decent but Older Rooms
Staff outstanding... Lobby area truly very Chic
reviews.text: Very Nice location. I would first off recommend if you want quiet then request High Floor, Marina side. If you don't mind the street noise and want a view of the city AND Ocean then request City/Ocean View again High floor but be prepared to look out over the parking lot and strip mall... Okay so the staff was excellent; friendly and courteous from the Bellman, Valet, Front Desk, housekeeping and Gift Shop. We had some cocktails in the lobby bar... 5 Martini's and 2 "very light" (think smaller than the size of a tapas) appetizers cost us over $100.00!!

My boyfriend raved over the refreshing beverages served in the Lobby every day a different Aqua al Fresco each day! We walked every night across the street to the beach and Marina looked at the boats enjoyed a very nice peaceful and relaxing 2 1/2 days. Room Service was prompt and efficient. Room itself was okay balcony was really super small you could go out but you couldn't sit it was just one of those you could walk out and barely turn... they don't want you on the Balconies and you can not smoke out on them so don't attempt to do so.
reviews.title: Above average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking $26.00 at the hotel or waltz your booty across the street park it your dang self it will cost you $6.00 for 24 hours!
reviews.title: Very Nice Indeed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely loved the lobby area very chic, inviting you to lounge and have a cocktail... expensive one or wait until happy hour (house brands, beer and wine only). Also they have complimentary wi-fi in the Lobby area but it will cost you $12.95 to use in your room. Many guests felt the way we did because it was consistently busy down there. Glow is nice and trendy we went out there for a second but it was cold and windy and although they have plenty of fire "places" we sat inside. Wasn't impressed with the appetizers we ordered Tuna Tartar and Calamari blah nothing to write home about. Drinks WERE strong boyfriend had a Belvedere Martini that he about convinced me that the "GODS of Liqour made themselves" LOL and I had a Peach Bellini which was quite delicious... hence my ordering 3 OF THEM!! *hiccup
reviews.title: Great Location and Great Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed Xmas week and had a great time. The best part of the hotel is the Lobby. The inside has nice sitting areas and a cool bar. You can also sit outside and if it's cold as it was when we were there, blazing gas fires and heat lamps created warmth and ambiance. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was terrific, especially for a longer stay. This was a quiet week which we think contributed to availability of an upgrade. From the hotel, you can walk to the marina and a small commercial area which may be more lively in the summer. We chose to walk to Venice and Venice beach via the canal streets which were lovely. Parking - valet ($26) was our only option at the hotel, so we told them we were not interested, so they said how about $19? We still said no and found easy free parking on Washington Blvd. across the street from the back of the hotel. There is a keyed entrance at the back of the hotel which is not so easy to find, but was very convenient. The staff was very friendy, relaxed, and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Location in LA. Friendy Staff. Not a cat 6 but still nice.

reviews.text: I was surprised to see that the average mark for this hotel at the moment is 3.5.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed here at least a dozen times, and every time I've had a thoroughly enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Exemplary Service - Most Beautiful View
Very nice surprise
reviews.text: The lobby is beautiful, always smells gorgeous, and the fresh fruit water on tap is lovely on a warm day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar and restaraunt staff are very friendly. At reception they're also quite friendly and efficient. - The pool area is quite small, but I can't remember ever having a problem getting a sun lounger, and the jacuzzi is a nice addition.
reviews.title: Less than Average Hotel for the price

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Marina Del Rey Marriot and found it to be very clean, with friendly staff and nice rooms (try and get a marina view room).
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was completely non-smoking, which suits some but not everyone (watch out if you have a cigarette on your balcony, as a sign states that guests found doing so will be fined approx. US$300!!!!).
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: The concierge and bell-staff were very efficient and friendly and I even got a free ride in the hotel's car when I needed to go to a local store.
reviews.title: Sophisticated Marriott
Watch Out !!!!
reviews.text: There are some great restaurants close to the hotel, including a Cheesecake Factory and the hotel's location is farily peaceful and a great alternative for staying int eh LA area, with Venice Beach and Sanata Monica only a few minutes away.
This is mainly a business-orientated hotel, but its location only 10 minutes away fro LAX makes it a winner, especially as it is not on any flightpath.
reviews.title: Marriott was Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there for 3 nights on af 14-days Californien roundtrip. Booked through Priceline at 115$/night. Room and hotel was fine. Just park on the other side of the road.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with OK location

reviews.text: 700 Meters to the beach (borderline of Venice and Marina Del Rey)
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but cleanliness lacking

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel on 13th December 2009. The rooms were lovely overlooking the Marina however the events that followed were less than pleansant. Firstly both rooms were opened by the cleaning crew at 10pm at night to clean the bathrooms. Luckily we had the security locks on otherwise they woudl have found us in bed. In one room the coffee pot had mold growing in it. In the other room the bath was not cleaned at all and has someone else scum in the bottom and around it. In addition to that in my elderly parents room the smoke alarm went off at midnight - although there was not smoke and no fire - it was justa fault. So although the hotel was very nice the health, hygiene and maintenance leave a lot to be desired.
reviews.title: Team Building Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A group of 13 colleagues stayed at the Marriott. The rooms were comfortable and large. The bathrooms were good for 2 people. The lounge outside was awesome, we had drinks outside almost every night. The only downside, one in our group had a room overlooking the outdoor courtyard and heard the music all night. Would ask for a room with a view of the marina. Nothing fancy but good for work. Plus, we got a good group rate.
reviews.title: Elegant in the heart of the Marina
Good location, great staff, typical Marriott experience
reviews.text: Would stay here again. Great location, close to good restaurants and valet was quick.

reviews.title: Great Hotel!!
reviews.text: Excellent accomodations. Friendly staff. Great location. Spacious room. Nice lobby bar,

A very, very nice Marriott. Great staff, large spotless rooms, great location. Both sides of the hotel have good views. Rooms are incredibly quiet, the bed comfortable. The only minor hitch: only wired computer connection in the room. Slowed my Mac down to less than half the speed I'm used to. Strange for an otherwise classy place.
reviews.title: As Good As It Gets

reviews.text: Restaurant also very good. A long, narrow design, but broken up to give a sense of privacy. $25 three course special was quite good and a value.
reviews.title: Impressive lobby, good location, decent rooms
great staff but club spoils
reviews.text: Can't miss with this hotel. Highly recommended.

We spent 3 nights at the M and were quite satisfied. Some minor cleaning issues at the lobby bar but the room was nice and clean. We had Marina view 4th floor. No noise from the parties downstairs as we were at the other far end. Beds very comfy. So close to drive to from LAX. Expensive valet parking fee can easily be waved by parking public across the street. One negative is the high fee on internet. Yes, they have free WiFi in the lobby bar. But that´s not convenient and connections were slow. Overall quite a good hotel considering the location. You can walk to Café del Rey (excellent) and one of the early Cheesecake Factories with water views.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but attention needed on small details

reviews.text: This hotel exceeded my expectations of what Marriotts are typically like. It was more upscale in all respects. The architecture and lobby were tasteful, artsy, interesting. Service was excellent from everyone I dealt with (particularly the valet parking staff, which I found very fast and helpful). The room was clean and comfortable and most importantly quiet. Nice bed, nice bathroom. I appreciated the free computer/internet use in the business center. I ate one breakfast in the lobby restaurant, and the food was fine (nothing amazing, but fine) and the service was excellent and friendly. Similarly, a room service dinner one night was also good, served promptly, and with good service. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. I would mention that I booked this using "name your own price" on Priceline, so I got a very good rate. I thought the full rack rates were pricey, but hotels in this area tend to be expensive.
reviews.title: Better than your average Marriott

likes.disliked: — A little hard to find when driving there the first time

reviews.text: We just returned from LA. Our son lives in Santa Monica and attends LMU. I wanted to stay at a central location with a view, a great place to have a drink and other amenties we could share during our brief stay. From the moment we arrived, I knew I had the right place. The little things like easy access for printing a boarding pass, to the help we got at the front desk and a great thoughtful crew in valet. The pool was perfect- clean and well supplied. The fitness room had new machines and TVs. I'd still be in the jacuzzi if I didn't have to leave. We enjoyed Glow, the outdoor bar, well into the night. The fireplaces and waterfall were the perfect compliment to a beautiful night. The service at Glow was prompt and pleasant. We had breakfast w/ the concierge Rewards room on the 8th floor with a great selection of fresh food. The valet had our car out front and bags loaded before I finished checking out. Three different workers asked if I needed directions or if they could help in anyway. If you want a great experience, check this place out- the view is the only thing I can't give them credit for. KC
reviews.title: need directions

reviews.text: I have stayed here many times and it is always great. The location is perfect and the hotel is always clean and service is always at its best. If you want to stay in a neutral area between Santa Monica and Redondo Beach, this place hits the spot!
reviews.title: Always Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night here. Perfect Hotel. Great staff, Views. All positive to say except the DJ music was too techno, wine is $12 each fyi, room service is $$$. (which is normal though). The lobby is gorgeous with a cool outdoor lounge area with couches & funky fireplaces to hang out in. Rooms are nice- clean, comfy bed, neat views. Took a cab to the Sunset strip which was bumper to bumper on a Friday night but worth going to since you are in LA. So much to do in this area- Malibu. Santa Monica, Venice, Beverly Hills, Hollywood. On the top floor they have an outdoor area for parties, wedding, whatever which has gorgeous views. Would stay here again...
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a regular room and were upgraded on arrival to a junior suite, which is a full two-room suite with a balcony. Stayed 4 nights. Very nicely done suite, contemporary , two TV's, phones everywhere, fabulously comfortable bed, wonderful view of L.A., beaches toward Santa Monica, Hollywood Hills, etc. Full breakfast in concierge club was very good. Lobby is gorgeous, "Glow" is the name of the beautiful outside lounge/bar area...has fire pits, heaters, beautiful plants, etc. This is a full four star hotel (and I stay in a lot of hotels) and is still in process of being updated in places. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Rates were excellent...good value for product...$249/night for the suite.
reviews.title: Highly recommend this hotel..is 4 star, at least.

likes.liked: — Hotel style and location with good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, easy access to and from LAX airport. The staff is great. I recieved a welcome email from the hotel regarding my upcoming stay. I phoned the hotel a day or two ahead of my visit to request info on whale watching and items needed in my room and everything was taken care of. The staff was very friendly. There is only valet parking available, but this is true of most of hte best hotels in the Marina del Rey area. Great restaurants nearby. Glow nightly entertainment with a DJ was good. The best is the breatfast buffet and dinner! The lamb chops are the best in town and fish with mushroom ravioli is wonderful. Wished we had discovered this find the day we arrived instead of hte night before our departure. Free wifi in the lobby with comfortable seating. The exercise room is small but sufficient, but go for a run outside in stead and enjoy the weather. The beach / ocean is just 7 mins drive away.
reviews.title: Go!

reviews.text: Nice concierge lounge with good food and actual working computer and printer. Good restaurants within walking or driving distance.
reviews.title: Nice lobby and Bar, but rooms are average.

reviews.text: We stayed for just one night and were in need of a good hotel close to LAX.
reviews.title: Convenient and well run hotel but tired and in need of a refit

reviews.text: This isn't a cheap hotel and whilst well located it clearly has high levels of guest traffic and is overdue for refurbishment.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but noisy music

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite being a close to $300 room the minibar was i) empty and ii) placed on a heavy duty blue plastic tray opposite the bed - presumably due to leaks, which begs the question...if it's only filled on request, why bother?
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott for a long weekend and loved the hotel!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Our arrival was several hours late, due to an airline problem, so when we arrived frazzled and without bags, Ricardo at the front desk helped us out. Even though we had managed to find a below market rate, he gave us a larger room - the building is somewhat "S-shaped" and the rooms near the "bends" in the hotel are larger than the rest.
reviews.title: Do not mind the front desk people-THIS PLACE IS GREAT
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Higher floors have better views, as you would expect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable, and the room had the usual furniture, including a large desk and an upholstered chair and ottoman. The TV was typical hotel room size - almost too small for the room being as large as it was. There was a small balcony outside - about 1 foot deep - just enough to step out and enjoy the view.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: The bathroom was good sized, a lot of natural stone. For some reason,
reviews.title: The disco has negatively changed this hotel

description: Located just 3 blocks from Venice Beach, Marriott Marina del Rey has 370 beautiful newly renovated guest rooms with marina and city views, private balconies and daily newpaper, heated outdoor pool, 24-hr fitness facility and business center, world-famous outdoor Glow lounge with water and fire features, full-service restaurant and bar, room service, laundry services, gift shop, Hertz Car Rental in lobby, valet parking. Located across the street from Marina del Rey Harbor with sand beach, with huge variety of shopping and restaurant choices within walking distance, public transportation outside of hotel, 5.4 miles from LAX airport, 2.0 miles to Santa Monica Pier and 3rd Street Promenade. Local attractions include Getty Museum, Universal Studios, Disneyland, Los Angeles Zoo, Aquarium of the Pacific.
